content: Phil Mickelson, who turns 55 on June 16, may get his last chance at a career Grand Slam at the U.S. Open next week in Pittsburgh. He's a six-time runner-up.

content: N. Ajith Kumar operated a clinic-cum-pharmacy in Venkatasamudram village, treating 35-50 patients daily without any professional medical qualifications

title: New pedestrian subway to enhance safety at Polur railway crossing near Tiruvannamalai
content: The subway, featuring tiled footpaths, steel hand railings, and stormwater drainage, is expected to be completed within three months; it is expected to improve daily commutes for over 6,000 passengers, including pilgrims and local residents

title: Thiruvananthapuram airport gasps for breath as terminal capacity utilisation crosses 100%
content: While international terminal utilised over 100% terminal capacity in the just-concluded fiscal, the capacity utilisation of domestic terminal was about 200% last year

title: Bengaluru stampede: How what was to be a victory celebration ended in tragedy

content: Shankar Malakar boosts Trinamool Congress‚Äô electoral prospects in 2026 Assembly elections by joining party

title: Bengal plans 800-km ‚Äògreen wall‚Äô along Jharkhand border
content: Will act as a shield in intercepting pollutants entering the State, says W.B Pollution Control Board Chairperson Kalyan Rudra

title: Webinar on liver disease to be held on June 8
content: Metabolic Dysfunction ‚Äî Associated Steatotic Liver Disease is an increasingly common yet often undiagnosed liver condition driven by metabolic disorders such as obesity, Type 2 diabetes, and insulin resistance

title: Seven more deaths reported as the number of COVID-19 cases rises above 4,300
content: Maharashtra reported the highest number of deaths (four); one death each has been reported from Delhi, Gujarat, and Tamil Nadu

title: Government to bring new national policy on senior citizens
content: The Social Justice Ministry says discussions focused on how the draft policy should ‚Äúreflect the demographic realities‚Äù of India as it heads into the future

title: Dishing out tasty treats made of milk
content: Final-year BTech (Dairy Technology) students of College of Dairy Science and Technology at Kaimanam run food stalls in the city selling value-added products from milk

title: Can Ambitious Green Wall Project Save The Aravallis? What Expert Said
content: Tomorrow, on World Environment Day 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will plant the first saplings of the Aravalli Green Wall Project in Delhi's Ridge.

title: Putin Said Very Strongly He'll "Have To Respond": Trump On Ukraine Drone Strike
content: US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he and Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke for more than an hour during which the Russian leader made it very clear that Moscow will "have to respond" to the daring drone attack launched by Ukraine.

title: 11 Dead In Stampede Outside Bengaluru Stadium Amid RCB Celebrations
content: The frenzied celebration in Bengaluru over RCB winning the IPL after 18 long years took a tragic turn with at least 11 people feared dead in a stampede.

title: Muslim Law Board Warns Of Contempt Petition Against Centre Over Waqf Portal
content: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board has taken exception to the Centre's move to activate the Waqf Umeed Portal from June 6.

title: "No Celebration Is Worth A Human Life": Rahul Gandhi On Bengaluru Stampede
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday called the stampede near Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's IPL victory celebrations "heartbreaking" and expressed condolences to the families of the victims, which claimed 11 lives.

title: 13 Suspected Bangladeshi Infiltrators Detained In Tripura
content: In a development that has stirred fresh concerns over cross-border infiltration and internal security in Tripura, thirteen individuals -including two women-were detained from a residence on the outskirts of Agartala by the Amtali police.

title: Paris Seeks Personhood Status For River Seine To Protect Its Ecosystem
content: French authorities want to give legal rights to the River Seine to better defend the world-famous waterway in court and protect its fragile ecosystem, part of a global movement to grant legal personhood to nature.

title: Exclusive: Amid Kannada Language Row, Kamal Haasan's "No Apology Over Gunpoint"
content: A day ahead of the pan-India release of his much-anticipated film 'Thug Life', actor and politician Kamal Haasan addressed the media but refrained from revisiting the controversy over his recent remarks about the Kannada language.

title: "False Endorsements, Real Losses": AI-Enabled Financial Scams On The Rise
content: A digital risk firm has raised an alarm over the rapid rise of AI-enabled financial scams in India in a devastating report that analysed some cases, including a deep fake video of Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Bengaluru Stampede Video Shows People Panicking, Trying To Save Others
content: A video of the chaos that unfolded outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has emerged, showing thousands of people standing at the gates of the stadium, which is locked by the security.

title: IIT Delhi Student Found Dead In Hostel Room, Was Last Seen On Monday
content: A student has been found dead at his hostel room in IIT Delhi. The room was locked from the inside and there were no external injuries on his body..

title: Kirori Lal Meena, Rajasthan's Maverick Minister, Back In Action
content: Rajasthan's agriculture minister Kirori Lal Meena is on a mission, carrying out surprise checks at the state's seed and fertiliser units and sealing factories churning out spurious items.

title: Aviation Regulator Pulls Up Turkish Airlines Over Safety Violations
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) found multiple safety violations in Turkish Airlines operations during surprise inspections carried out between May 29 and June 2 at four major Indian airports.

title: Man Killed After His Car Collides Head-On With Tanker In UP's Kushinagar
content: A man died after his car collided head-on with a tanker in Hata area of Uttar Pradesh's Kushinagar district, police said on Wednesday.

title: "Stadium Capacity 35,000 But 2-3 lakh Turned Up": Siddaramaiah On RCB Tragedy
content: Hours after 11 people died in a stampede today, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah admitted they did not expect such huge crowds to turn up at the IPL victory celebrations of RCB in Bengaluru.

title: "Let Chief Minister Fix Responsibility": Karnataka BJP Head On Stampede
content: The Karnataka BJP has demanded action and accountability over lapses that led to two stampedes in Bengaluru during the IPL victory celebrations of RCB. Eleven people were killed in stampedes.

title: "Officials Inside Stadium Weren't Aware": IPL Chairman On Celebrations Amid Tragedy
content: Officials who were inside a stadium in Bengaluru during the RCB victory celebrations were not aware what was happening outside, IPL chairman Arun Dhumal said, hours after 11 people were killed in two stampedes.

title: Chinnaswamy Stadium Stampede LIVE: 11 Dead In Bengaluru Stampede; Siddaramaiah Says Over 2 Lakh Showed Up
content: Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede LIVE Updates: At least 11 people died and 50 were injured outside the Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru as thousands of fans gathered to greet the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) after winning the IPL.

title: "Players Had Commitments": Siddaramaiah Aide On Short Notice For RCB Event
content: The size of the crowd that had gathered for the celebrations of RCB's victory in the IPL was unexpected and "nobody could have visualised it", Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's Political Secretary Naseer Ahmed has said.

title: Rankings: Arike Ogunbowale enters top 10
content: Arike Ogunbowale, Rhyne Howard and Ariel Atkins are some of the biggest movers in this week's fantasy women's basketball rankings.

content: As we prepare for Game 1 of the NBA Finals, we take a look back at the iconic images that defined these playoffs.

content: Manchester United could turn to Paris Saint-Germain striker Goncalo Ramos after missing out on Ipswich Town's Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Madden NFL 26 reveals first look at gameplay with new trailer
content: The upcoming franchise entry features player-specific traits and adaptive counters that match real-life strategies.

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister alleges BJP‚Äôs postponement of Census to 2027 is aimed at altering State‚Äôs representation and urges ‚Äúfair delimitation‚Äù

title: Waqf Umeed portal tantamount to contempt of court, claims Muslim Board
content: The AIMPLB contends that at a time when petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 are under consideration of the Supreme Court such a move is tantamount to contempt of court

title: Railways suspends 2.5 crore user IDs suspected of fraudulent ticket booking
content: IRCTC deployes anti-bot systems to curb bookings by unscrupulous agents and reduce bot traffic during the first five minutes of the Tatkal booking window

title: Bar Council nod for government law college in Chamarajanagar
content: College granted permission to admit 60 students for the three-year LL.B course for academic years 2025‚Äì26 and 2026‚Äì27

title: Kudumbashree to provide all vegetables needed for Onasadya: Minister
content: Inaugurates Onakani project for making available Onam kits that include vegetables, pickle, chips, payasam mix, and spice powders needed for a sadya

title: Complete TUDA Towers project by October, says Divakar Reddy
content: The project is coming up on 15 floors spread over 3.60 acres, with a total built-up area of 8,28,300 sq.ft.

title: India, Australia agree to work together to combat terrorism in all its forms
content: Australian Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles calls on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, reviews the defence partnership between the two countries

title: Concern over revision of FYUGP regulations in Calicut varsity
content: The revised clause will undermine interdisciplinary learning and limit employability prospects, especially for Commerce students, says Senate member

content: Countering terrorism post Operation Sindoor is a key theme for India; PM‚Äôs attendance comes despite U.S. concerns over India‚Äôs participation in BRICS and possible initiatives to find alternative trade currencies

content: Along with the local police, special squads from the District Anti-Narcotics Special Action Force and Crime Squad members under the District Police Chiefs will take part in flash inspections

content: Claimed to be the first of its kind in the State, the project was launched under the social policing wing of the Kozhikode City police

content: Separate FIRs registered in Bilaspur and Bhilai under provisions of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and IT Act

title: 100 new power sub-stations proposed in State: George
content: 44 sub-stations to be completed in Mysuru district within two years; Over 600 hamlets to be electrified under CESC limits

title: Malayalam film policy draft to be presented at conclave in August
content: A total of 75 meetings have been held with various stakeholders in the industry as part of efforts at formulating the policy, say sources

title: Rain spells take a toll on cardamom plantations in Idukki
content: According to Agriculture department, 310.69 ha of cardamom plantations have been destroyed in the strong wind and heavy rain in the district

title: Nandyal MP Byreddy Shabari highlights India‚Äôs progress on climate goal front at BRICS Parliamentary Forum in Brazil
content: She stresses the need for gender-inclusive climate policies, and the important role women can play in environment protection

title: IB officer‚Äôs death: accused taken to Kochi for evidence collection
content: Accused reportedly confesses that deceased IB officer had visited him at his apartment on multiple occasions

title: Municipal commissioners directed to step up sanitation ahead of monsoon
content: With the monsoon approaching, he cautioned the municipal health wing officials to be vigilant against outbreaks of waterborne diseases

title: 11 dead in Bengaluru stampede: How chaos & tragedy unfolded
content: A stampede at Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB victory celebrations resulted in 11 fatalities and 33 injuries. Prime Minister Modi expressed his condolences, while chief minister Siddaramaiah announced compensation and ordered an inquiry. The massive crowd overwhelmed security, leading to chaos despite police presence, prompting criticism of the state government's preparedness for the event.

title: 'Explosives on board': Surprise checks expose major lapses by Turkish Airlines
content: India has cautioned Turkish Airlines to adhere to regulations following safety inspections at multiple airports, revealing significant lapses. These include the alleged undisclosed carriage of explosives and procedural violations in ground operations. The DGCA will conduct follow-up inspections to ensure continuous safety oversight, emphasizing its commitment to regulatory compliance for foreign operators within Indian airspace.

title: 'Russia will respond to Ukraine attack': Donald Trump, Putin talk over phone
content: Donald Trump revealed a tense phone call with Vladimir Putin, addressing Ukraine's airfield strike and Iran's nuclear ambitions. Putin strongly indicated Russia would respond to the Ukrainian attack, while Trump insisted Iran cannot possess nuclear weapons. Trump previously gave Putin a two-week deadline to demonstrate progress toward peace in Ukraine, threatening a different approach if unmet.

title: Painting believed to be only one Gandhi sat for going under hammer at Bonhams
content: A rare oil portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, believed to be the only one he ever posed for, is set to be auctioned at Bonhams in July. Painted by British artist Clare Leighton in 1931 during Gandhi's visit to London, the artwork remained within Leighton's family until now.

title: 9 aircraft, radar sites: Details emerge of Pak's big losses during Op Sindoor
content: Operation Sindoor, India's retaliatory strikes following the Pahalgam terror attack, decimated significant Pakistani military assets, including fighter jets and missile systems. The Indian Air Force targeted key airbases using air-launched cruise missiles, prompting Pakistan to seek a ceasefire within four days. India dismissed Pakistan's claims of civilian casualties as propaganda, asserting strikes were limited to terror infrastructure.

title: War twist: Ukraine‚Äôs drone used my open-source code, says shocked developer
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: Celebration turns tragedy: 11 dead in Bengaluru stampede; political slugfest erupts
content: Tragedy struck Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations as a stampede near Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in eight fatalities and over 40 injuries. Overwhelmed by massive crowds, police struggled to maintain control despite a heavy presence. The Karnataka government's prior cancellation of a victory parade due to security concerns proved prescient.

title: 3,000 steps to death: Borrowed watch, tattoo & missing bride in Meghalaya hills
content: A newlywed couple's trip to Meghalaya turned tragic after they vanished from Nongriat. Raja Raghuvanshi's body was discovered in a gorge near Weisawdong Falls, identified by a tattoo and his smartwatch. Police suspect murder, finding a new dao at the scene. The search for Sonam continues amidst challenging weather.

title: B'luru stampede: Siddaramaiah says 'won't defend incident', name-drops Maha Kumbh
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah addressed the Bengaluru stampede that resulted in 11 fatalities, ordering a magisterial inquiry while refraining from defending the incident. He referenced past tragedies like the Kumbh Mela, while the BJP criticized the Congress-led government for negligence, citing inadequate planning and security.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis: If I were a student right now, I would study ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: Tragedy mars RCB's IPL title celebrations: BCCI questions organisers
content: A stampede occurred outside Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's victory celebration. The incident resulted in fatalities and injuries. IPL Governing Council Chairman Arun Dhumal contacted the franchise about the situation. BCCI Secretary Davajit Saikia called the incident unfortunate.

title: Canada's new Bill to tackle asylum claims; how it will affect Indian students
content: Canada's Strong Borders Act aims to bolster border security and curb fraudulent asylum claims, particularly from international students. The bill introduces stricter timelines for asylum applications and enhances information sharing between immigration authorities and other government bodies. These measures respond to rising migration pressures and seek to protect the integrity of Canada's immigration system amid increasing backlogs and policy changes.

title: How this London startup made 700 engineers sitting in India pose as AI tool
content: Builder.ai, once valued at $1.5 billion, has filed for bankruptcy after being exposed for misleading investors about its AI capabilities. The company, backed by Microsoft and Qatar's sovereign wealth fund, allegedly used Indian engineers to manually code apps while marketing them as AI-generated. This deception led to financial misrepresentations, regulatory scrutiny, and ultimately, the company's downfall.

title: After Op Sindoor, Bhutto turns into a boor, calls Modi a cheap version of Netanyahu
content: A war of words erupted between Indian and Pakistani delegations in Washington D.C. over the Pahalgam attack and Kashmir. Bilawal Bhutto's criticism of Prime Minister Modi drew a sharp response from Tejasvi Surya, highlighting Pakistan's reliance on Chinese products.

title: 'Heartrending': PM Modi says 'thoughts with those who lost loved ones' in stampede
content: A stampede near M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries, prompting Prime Minister Modi to express his grief. While initial reports indicated eight deaths, BJP Karnataka chief Vijayendra claimed a higher toll, demanding a judicial inquiry. Authorities are investigating the incident, with conflicting reports emerging regarding the exact number of casualties during the RCB's IPL 2025 victory celebration.

title: Parsons's bold message to Jones: Cowboys star commits to minicamp
content: Dallas Cowboys linebacker Micah Parsons has confirmed his attendance at the team's mandatory minicamp, despite ongoing contract negotiations. Parsons emphasized his commitment to his teammates and preparation for the upcoming season. He also subtly put pressure on team owner Jerry Jones to finalize his contract extension, suggesting the decision now rests with him.

title: Tragedy at victory parade: RCB break silence on stampede
content: A joyous victory for Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL turned tragic as a stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in 11 fatalities and 33 injuries. The incident occurred amidst a massive gathering of fans eager to celebrate the team's triumph.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Adha 2025: Best Eid Mubarak messages, quotes, wishes, and more
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 approaches, heralding a time for Muslims worldwide to commemorate Prophet Ibrahim's devotion through prayers, sacrifices, and acts of charity. Celebrations are expected to begin on June 7th, emphasizing unity and spreading joy with heartfelt messages and traditions. The festival underscores themes of sacrifice, compassion, and obedience.

title: B'luru stampede: BJP blames Cong's 'haste'; DKS gives 'ended in 10 mins' reply
content: Following a tragic stampede at an RCB IPL victory celebration in Bengaluru, Karnataka's Deputy CM, DK Shivakumar, has urged the public to remain calm, assuring that the government is working to restore normalcy. The incident, reportedly caused by overcrowding and mismanagement, resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries.

title: Chaos in Bengaluru: Fans climb over car, crush vehicle - Video
content: Celebrations for Royal Challengers Bengaluru's anticipated IPL title win descended into chaos in Bengaluru. A stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in at least seven fatalities and over 25 injuries. Frenzied fans damaged a car, shattering its windshield and denting the roof. Massive crowds had gathered to celebrate, but the jubilation quickly turned into disorder.

title: Census from March 2027: Caste enumeration to be part of exercise
content: The next nationwide census will begin on March 1, 2027, with Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, and Uttarakhand starting earlier in October 2026. For the first time in over seven decades, the census will include caste enumeration to ensure transparency and national consistency.

title: 'Let me speak...': Virat Kohli struggles to speak as crowd goes crazy during celebrations
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) celebrated their first IPL title win with fans at M Chinnaswamy Stadium. Virat Kohli praised captain Rajat Patidar and the team's loyal supporters, emphasizing their unwavering support over 18 years. Karnataka's Deputy CM and Governor congratulated RCB, acknowledging the team's long-awaited success and Kohli's dedication.

title: Allahabad HC rebukes Rahul: Free speech has limits, Army can't be defamed
content: The Allahabad High Court has rebuked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi regarding his alleged derogatory remarks against the Indian Army, emphasizing that freedom of speech under Article 19(1)(a) is subject to reasonable restrictions and does not extend to defamatory statements.

title: 'Love him': Allen Iverson gets emotional expressing feelings for Shaquille O'Neal
content: Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal and Allen Iverson recently shared a heartfelt interview. Iverson expressed deep affection and respect for O‚ÄôNeal. The duo, former All-Star teammates, promoted their Netflix docuseries, Power Moves. Iverson became emotional discussing their bond. They also collaborated as Reebok Basketball executives. The docuseries features their efforts to revive Reebok's basketball division. Their friendship highlights strong NBA camaraderies.

title: Watch: Fans climb trees and buses to witness RCB‚Äôs IPL victory
content: Bengaluru celebrated Royal Challengers Bengaluru's first IPL victory. Thousands of fans gathered, expressing joy after the team beat Punjab Kings. Celebrations started at Vidhana Soudha, where the Karnataka government held a felicitation. The team paraded to Chinnaswamy Stadium in an open-top bus. Over ten thousand fans joined the celebrations at the stadium.

title: 'Young and dumb': Jason Whitlock calls Stefon Diggs & Cardi B a ghetto version
content: Jason Whitlock critiques Stefon Diggs' priorities, suggesting his focus has shifted from football to celebrity, highlighted by his association with Cardi B. Whitlock compares their pairing unfavorably to Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift, deeming it a "ghetto version." T.J. Moe questions Diggs' value to the Patriots, citing declining performance and a potential distraction.

title: '18 years for me, 11 for her': Virat Kohli's touching message for Anushka Sharma
content: Virat Kohli's raw emotion poured out as Royal Challengers Bengaluru clinched their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings. Overwhelmed, Kohli collapsed on the field before sharing a tearful embrace with his wife, Anushka Sharma. He expressed their shared journey and relief, highlighting Anushka's special connection to Bangalore, making the victory even more meaningful for them both.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Adha 2025: Eid Mubarak images, wishes, messages, quotes and more
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 approaches, a time for Muslims worldwide to celebrate the Festival of Sacrifice. People are seeking heartfelt images, wishes, messages, and quotes to share with loved ones on social media platforms. The festival emphasizes love, compassion, and togetherness, encouraging acts of kindness and generosity in remembrance of Prophet Ibrahim's devotion.

title: Kuldeep Yadav gets engaged to childhood friend Vanshika in Lucknow
content: Indian cricket star Kuldeep Yadav, fondly known as the 'Chinaman,' recently celebrated his engagement to Vanshika, his childhood sweetheart, in a private ceremony in Lucknow. The intimate affair was graced by family and fellow cricketers, including Rinku Singh. While the couple has kept details under wraps, photos have surfaced online, sparking congratulatory messages.

title: AI cyber fraud: Inside Delhi‚Äôs ‚Äòtelecaller trap‚Äô; fraud kits, dummy a/cs powered racket
content: In Delhi, a sextortion gang led by Jahid allegedly used AI and social media to blackmail vulnerable individuals. Jayshree lured victims, while others impersonated police. Another call center, managed by Ujjawal Pandey and Gaurav Barua, offered fake loans, extracting fees before cutting contact. Telecallers like Akshita, Dimple, and Pinki, under Dilshad Ali, posed as loan representatives, deceiving customers.

title: Trump visa curbs: 'Totally quiet,' Cong questions PM's silence
content: Congress has voiced concerns over the potential impact of Donald Trump's visa policies on Indian students in the US, noting that approximately 337,630 Indian students pursued higher education there in 2024. Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Modi and EAM Jaishankar for their silence on the matter, contrasting it with China's strong reaction to protect its students' interests.

title: 'True definition of a son': NBA legend Allen Iverson shares heartfelt post
content: Allen Iverson recently shared a heartfelt Instagram post praising his son, Isaiah Rahsaan Iverson, highlighting his admirable qualities and expressing immense pride. This follows a previous dedication to his ex-wife, Tawanna Turner, showcasing their past together. Despite facing financial struggles post-retirement, Iverson's life is seemingly improving with a new role at Reebok.

title: Chenab bridge: PM Modi to inaugrate world‚Äôs highest railway arch bridge
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Chenab Bridge, the world's highest railway arch bridge, marking a significant step towards enhanced connectivity in the region. The Vande Bharat trains will traverse the bridge, reducing travel time between Katra and Srinagar to approximately three hours.

title: Honeymooner hacked to death in Meghalaya: What wife‚Äôs last call to mom-in-law hinted at
content: Indore honeymooner Raja Raghuvanshi was found murdered in a gorge near Weisawdong falls, Meghalaya, with evidence suggesting he was hacked to death with a machete. Police are investigating the crime, searching for his missing wife, Sonam, and the culprits, while the family demands a CBI probe and Army assistance.

title: Is WW3 near? Meet hypnotherapist Nicolas Aujula whose 2025 warning sparks fear
content: Amid global instability, psychic Nicolas Aujula's 2025 predictions are gaining traction, echoing Baba Vanga's mystique. Aujula foresees a potential World War III fueled by a lack of compassion, alongside natural disasters and political shifts. His past accuracy, including predictions of Trump's return and the rise of AI, lends credibility to his alarming visions.

title: Virat Kohli's curious IPL trophy peek; RCB star checks what's inside
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru won the Indian Premier League after 18 seasons. They defeated Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli, an iconic player, expressed his joy. He dedicated the win to the fans and the team's resilience. Kohli also shared a heartfelt message on Instagram. He amassed 657 runs this season.

title: 'Parliamentophobia': TMC MP after Centre calls Monsoon Session
content: TMC leader Derek O'Brien accuses the Modi government of "Parliamentophobia" for allegedly avoiding parliamentary scrutiny. This jab follows the INDIA bloc's request for a special session to discuss Operation Sindoor. The opposition emphasizes the need for parliamentary debate on critical national security issues, while the government suggests addressing these concerns during the upcoming Monsoon session.

title: 10 hidden facts about Earth: Amazing truths that sound like sci-fi stories
content: Earth harbors incredible secrets, from remnants of a planet that formed the Moon residing deep within, to ancient auroras illuminating the skies. The planet's molten core influenced early human migration, while ancient crystals reveal water existed 4.3 billion years ago. Discoveries like a supernova's mark in the ocean and a sinking North America highlight Earth's dynamic and surprising history.

title: Hot topic: Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal makes Travis Kelce dances to Taylor Swift‚Äôs song
content: NBA legend Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal surprised everyone by revealing his love for Taylor Swift's song. He sang along to 'I Knew You Were Trouble' on the Kelce brothers' podcast. Travis Kelce also mentioned Taylor Swift regained ownership of her music. The Kelce brothers welcomed Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal to their New Heights podcast. The episode is set to premiere on June 4, 2025.

title: SC quashes rape charges: Man refuses to marry woman over ‚Äòaggressive sexual nature‚Äô
content: The Supreme Court has dismissed rape charges against a man, citing the woman's "aggressive sexual behaviour" and manipulative tendencies. Justices Nath and Mehta referenced social media chats where the woman, known as 'Muffin,' admitted to manipulation and targeting men for personal gain, including seeking a green card.

title: 'Really hard': LeBron James‚Äô wife reveals how being a teen mom affected her
content: Savannah James, wife of LeBron James, recently shared her experiences with motherhood on the podcast 'Everybody‚Äôs Crazy,' revealing how it shaped her identity. She admitted struggling to find herself outside of being a mom, especially with her sons.

title: Anushka Sharma joins Virat Kohli for RCB's IPL victory celebrations; crowd goes crazy
content: After 18 seasons of anticipation, Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) clinched their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. Virat Kohli's emotional celebration with his wife, Anushka Sharma, captured the historic moment. The victory marked a significant milestone for the franchise and its loyal fanbase, rewarding their unwavering support over the years.

title: 'Vindictive nature': Imran Khan alleges Asim Munir targeted his wife
content: Imran Khan has accused Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, of a personal vendetta against his wife, Bushra Bibi, stemming from Munir's removal as ISI chief. Khan alleges that Bibi's imprisonment and mistreatment are due to Munir's vindictive nature, further claiming she refused contact after his dismissal.

title: Weeks before attack, Colorado terror suspect‚Äôs daughter praised US for giving her future
content: Just before Mohamed Soliman's alleged terror attack in Colorado, his daughter Habiba spoke of her American dream. Now, following the antisemitic attack in Boulder, both are in ICE custody facing deportation. Soliman is accused of throwing Molotov cocktails at a pro-Israeli hostage march, injuring twelve.

title: Betting interest on Fever games dips by half after Caitlin Clark injury
content: the amount wagered on the Fever's two games last week at Caesars Sportsbook was half as much as the team's first four games of the season . caitlin Clark suffered a quad strain . the team attracted more than 90% of the money-line bets in its first three games .

title: Expert picks for Thunder-Pacers
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder and Indiana Pacers are the last two teams left standing . the Pacers won the series in five games, four of which featured 30-plus point outings from NBA MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander . this is the Thunder's second finals appearance, and it would be their first as the Oklahoma city Thunder .

title: Don't hesitate to get Harper and Chisholm back into lineups

title: Blockbuster semifinal at the French Open: Will Swiatek or Sabalenka win?
content: aryna Sabalenka and Iga Swiatek face off in the semifinals at the french open on friday . the two have played 12 times, with the pair leading 8-4 overall and 5-1 on clay . femail's samir khan is the world's no. 1 for the first time since the semis .

title: Conn Smythe Watch: Connor McDavid for MVP of the playoffs -- win or lose?

title: Why the Panthers will win the Stanley Cup (again)

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
